questions.question: What is the primary focus of the Data Link Layer?
options: Achieving reliable communication between adjacent machines
questions.answer: Achieving reliable communication between adjacent machines

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically a design issue of the Data Link Layer?
What is a primary responsibility of the Data Link Layer regarding data flow?
options: Assigning IP addresses to network interfaces
Regulating flow to prevent fast senders from overwhelming slow receivers
Compressing large data files for transmission
Managing DNS resolutions for local hosts
questions.answer: Regulating flow to prevent fast senders from overwhelming slow receivers

questions.question: What is the primary function of framing in the Data Link Layer?
options: To break the raw bit stream into discrete, manageable blocks
To encrypt individual bits for secure transmission
To determine the best physical path for a packet
To convert digital signals into analog waves
questions.answer: To break the raw bit stream into discrete, manageable blocks

questions.question: What are the three main components that make up a standard frame?
options: Start Bit, Stop Bit, Parity Bit

questions.question: Which service type is appropriate for real-time traffic, such as voice, where recovery is left to higher layers?
In which type of service is a logical connection established between source and destination before any data is transferred?
What does the Data Link Layer guarantee in an acknowledged connection-oriented service?
options: That each frame is received exactly once and in the correct order
That data is encrypted before reaching the physical layer
That no routing loops occur in the network
questions.answer: That each frame is received exactly once and in the correct order

questions.question: What happens when a frame arrives at the destination Data Link Layer?
options: The checksum is ignored to save processing time
The checksum is recomputed and compared with the one in the frame
The frame is automatically acknowledged before checking for errors
The trailer is stripped and discarded without verification
questions.answer: The checksum is recomputed and compared with the one in the frame

questions.question: What is a major disadvantage of the character count framing method?
options: A single-bit error in the count field makes resynchronization difficult
It is incompatible with copper-based transmission
questions.answer: A single-bit error in the count field makes resynchronization difficult

questions.question: In byte stuffing, what occurs if a flag byte or an ESCAPE byte appears within the actual data payload?
options: The byte is ignored by the receiver
An ESCAPE byte is inserted before it (stuffed)
questions.answer: An ESCAPE byte is inserted before it (stuffed)

questions.question: In bit-oriented protocols using bit stuffing, what is inserted after every sequence of five consecutive 1s in the data?
How does a receiver identify a frame boundary in a protocol using the bit sequence 01111110 as a flag?
options: By counting exactly 8 bits per frame
By searching for the unique 01111110 bit pattern
By relying on the physical layer timing
By checking the character count in the header
questions.answer: By searching for the unique 01111110 bit pattern

questions.question: Which of the following is a bit-oriented protocol mentioned as a standard user of bit stuffing?
What is the purpose of using 'non-data' symbols or coding violations for framing in the Physical Layer?
options: To increase the bit rate of the medium
To easily identify start and end boundaries of frames
To provide error correction for the payload
To reduce the power consumption of the transceiver
questions.answer: To easily identify start and end boundaries of frames
